p: Total nitrogen (NO 3 - + NH 4 +) was not different between cool (Oct–May) and warm (June–Sept) seasons ( Fig 3A: t = -1.14, P < 0.26). Total nitrogen tended to vary among years (1995–2017, Table 2: P < 0.09), especially for the warm season ( Table 2: P < 0.02). Total nitrogen tended to exhibit an increasing trend over our study ( Table 2: P < 0.09), especially for the warm season ( Table 2: P < 0.0002). Cool season NO 3 -, NH 4 + and total nitrogen exhibited no trends over our study (respective GLMM: P < 0.38, 0.31, 0.42), but warm season NO 3 -, NH 4 + and total nitrogen increased over our study ( Fig 3B) respectively by 200.8%, 38.6% and 94.8%.
